resources.string: Please enter your name. \nNote that white will start first:)
This game was developed by Samuel Zhu(Carleton University), Johnny Park(Carleton University), and Abdullah Baltaji(Carleton University).\n\n It was developed as a Hackathon project in CUHacking 2020.

It plays a simple five-in-a-row game, and can be controlled by voice by pressing a given mic button in the game page.

 There is two ways to play the game, one by touch and other by voice.

 To play by voice, one must press the mic button and speak in the given format similarly when playing chess.

 One must give "play &#" where & indicates a alphabet letter from a to m, and # indicates a number from 1-13. The alphabet indicates the row of the board starting from the top, and the number indicates the column starting from the left.
